text: Both S1 and S2 are FALSE. In a relation scheme multiple foreign attributes can be present referring to primary keys of other relation schemes. A typical example is an EXAM_RESULTS(sid,eid,marks) scheme where sid and eid are foreign keys referring to the primary keys in STUDENT and EXAM schemes respectively. . 52 is FALSE because a foreign key can refer to the same scheme (self-referencing foreign key). A typical example is an EMPLOYEE(eid, mid, . ..) scheme where mid is the Manager ID referring to the primary key eid of the same scheme. e
